intro: Dieteria pulverulenta, commonly known as the dusty dieteria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that are often clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine, powdery coating, giving it its common name. Dieteria pulverulenta is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
